intro: Fagara gilletii var. cordata, commonly known as the cordate fagara, is a shrub native to the humid forests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves, which are typically dark green and glossy. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in terminal panicles, followed by red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various wildlife. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests.
